attributes.action: Stop the development of 5000 new homes on the Historic Parlington Estate, Leeds.
attributes.additional_details:
If successful the development will commence in 2019/2020 delivering around 1750 homes before 2029. 

Full details of what is planned can be found here:

http://democracy.leeds.gov.uk/ieListDocuments.aspx?CId=450&MId=7506

For more information about the history of the Parlington Estate please 
visit 

www.parlington.co.uk/
www.facebook.com/parlingtonhistory/
www.parlington.info
http://leedscivictrust.org.uk/?idno=1205
attributes.background: Stop the proposed development of 5000 new homes on the Historic Parlington Estate, Between Aberford, Barwick-in-Elmet and Garforth near Leeds. Developers have tabled a proposal to Leeds City Council Development Plans Panel to build 5000 new homes on the Parlington Estate in North East Leeds.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Planning related to housing development is the responsibility of your local council (http://www.leeds.gov.uk/). 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: 
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors 

Your local council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here: http://democracy.leeds.gov.uk/mgEPetitionListDisplay.aspx?bcr=1
